message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.MM

Reasoning: The paper deals with the analysis of ARQ protocols over packet erasure channels, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT). The use of queuing and coding theory also suggests a possible fit with the networking and internet architecture sub-category (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the use of forward error-correction and matrix signal-flow graphs, which are techniques commonly used in control systems and systems engineering (cs.SY). The use of coding theory and the analysis of throughput and delay also suggest a possible fit with the distributed, parallel, and cluster computing sub-category (cs.DS). Finally, the use of soft combining at the receiver and the comparison of coded and uncoded protocols suggest a possible fit with the multimedia sub-category (cs.MM).
